conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with coil properties and rotation details
Determine magnetic flux through the coil using formula Phi_B = BL^2cos(omega t)
Calculate induced EMF using Faraday's law resulting in EMF = NBL^2omega sin(omega t)
Calculate effective RMS value of EMF as EMF_rms = NBL^2omega/sqrt(2)
Reconsidering the flux calculation due to axis not passing through center of square
Insight that axis of rotation is at distance L/4 from side ab, affecting flux calculation
Revised calculation of magnetic flux as Phi_B = NBL^2cos(omega t)
Revised calculation of induced EMF as EMF = NBL^2omega sin(omega t)
Revised calculation of effective RMS value as EMF_rms = NBL^2omega/sqrt(2)
